dt: {bc}to make fast with or as if with a lock
{bc}to fasten in or out or to make secure or inaccessible by or as if by means of {a_link|locks}

dt.t: {wi}locked{/wi} himself away from the curious world

dt: {bc}to fix in a particular situation or method of operation

dt.t: a team firmly {wi}locked{/wi} in last place

dt: {bc}to make fast, motionless, or inflexible especially by the interlacing or interlocking of parts

dt.t: administration and students were {wi}locked{/wi} in conflict

dt: {bc}to invest (capital) without assurance of easy convertibility into money
{bc}to move or permit to pass (something, such as a ship) by raising or lowering in a lock
{bc}to go or pass by means of a lock (as in a canal)
{bc}to acquire (something, such as a target or signal) automatically using a sensor (such as radar)

shortdef: to make fast with or as if with a lock
to fasten in or out or to make secure or inaccessible by or as if by means of locks

dt: {bc}unable or unwilling to shift invested funds because of the tax effect of realizing capital gains

shortdef: unable or unwilling to shift invested funds because of the tax effect of realizing capital gains

dt: used to say that someone is looking at someone or something and not looking at anything else

dt.t: His {it}eyes were locked on{/it} her as she walked across the room.

shortdef: —used to say that someone is looking at someone or something and not looking at anything else

dt: {bc}to subject (a body of employees) to a lockout

shortdef: to subject (a body of employees) to a lockout

dt: {bc}to put (something) in a locked container, place, etc.

dt.t: The jewelry was {it}locked away{/it} in a cabinet.

dt: {bc}to put (someone) in a locked place (such as a prison) for a long period of time

dt.t: The state {it}locked{/it} their sister {it}away{/it} in a psychiatric hospital.

dt: {bc}to keep (oneself) alone in a room or place for a long period of time

dt.t: He {it}locked{/it} himself {it}away{/it} in his room while he studied.
He was {it}locked away{/it} in his room while he studied.

shortdef: to put (something) in a locked container, place, etc.
to put (someone) in a locked place (such as a prison) for a long period of time
to keep (oneself) alone in a room or place for a long period of time
